titleStmt.title: The case of the undertakers for reducing postage of inland letters to just and moderate rates, stated. And therein, the liberty of a commonwealth, the weal of the merchant and industrious trader, and the birthright of every free-man viindicated from monopolizing restraints, and mercenary farming of puplike [sic] offices.
titleStmt.author: Oxenbridge, Clement.

titleStmt.title: The case of the undertakers for reducing postage of inland letters to just and moderate rates, stated. And therein, the liberty of a commonwealth, the weal of the merchant and industrious trader, and the birthright of every free-man viindicated from monopolizing restraints, and mercenary farming of puplike [sic] offices.
titleStmt.author: Oxenbridge, Clement.

notesStmt.note: By Clement Oxenbridge. Cf. Wing (2nd ed.).
Place and date of publication suggested by Wing (2nd ed.).
Reproduction of original in: Columbia University Library (New York, N.Y.).
With: To all ingenuous people: a second intimation fro the new undertakers for conveyance of letters at half the rates ... [London : s.n., 1653].
